title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by removing section 604 and related items, with Congress exercising its rulemaking power. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by Congress, allowing for the modification of rules with recognition of constitutional rights. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended in various sections, including changes to subsections and the removal of certain provisions. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended in various sections, including changes to subsections and the removal of certain provisions related to payments for revenue anticipation notes and initiative and referendum processes. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by removing certain provisions related to elections, specifically in subsections (j)(2) and (m), to streamline the process. The amendments made by this Act, effective from October 1, 2002, apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed by the Council and signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed, passed and allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of registered qualified electors.
